## PHYSICS

Paper 3 Extended  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[90, 339, 415, 356]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 393, 386, 411]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 719, 435]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 325, 449]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 448, 578, 464]]<|/det|>
You may use a pencil for any diagrams, graphs or rough working.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 463, 598, 479]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 477, 380, 493]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 503, 255, 518]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 517, 766, 548]]<|/det|>
You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. Take the weight of \(1\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (i.e. acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 558, 604, 574]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 572, 755, 588]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 107, 92]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 92]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 808, 122]]<|/det|> In a laboratory's secure radioactivity cupboard are two unlabelled radioactive scientist knows that one is an alpha-emitter and the other is a beta-emitter, but which is which. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 660, 152]]<|/det|> A radiation detector, a magnet and some paper are available. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 163, 920, 196]]<|/det|> Briefly describe two different experimental tests, using this equipment, which would allow the scientist to identify which is the alpha-emitter and which is the beta-emitter. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[101, 207, 897, 509]]<|/det|>
testoutcome for alphaoutcome for beta
